snippet: Border camps in Serbia began to dissipate, and the top migration official in Germany stepped down after coming under fire for a Twitter post.
abstract: European Union remains haplessly disunified on solution to worsening migrant crisis, ahead of emergency meeting in Brussels; Eastern European countries look to Western Europe for advice and assistance, yet scoff at potential burden imposed by proposal to resettle refugees equally throughout EU.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew Higgins in Brussels; Melissa Eddy in Berlin; Helene Bienvenu in Horgos, Serbia; Palko Karasz in Budapest; Joseph Orovic in Tovarnik, Croatia; Matthew Brunwasser in Sid, Serbia; Kristina Bozic in Ljubljana, Slovenia; and Miroslava Germanova in Bratislava, Slovakia.

lead_paragraph: Border camps in Serbia began to dissipate, and the top migration official in Germany stepped down after coming under fire for a Twitter post.

headline.main: Europe Lacks Strategy to Tackle Crisis, but Migrants March On
headline.print_headline: Confusion Grows as Solution to Crisis Eludes Europe

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
